Dear Mr. Macy:
I recently had the pleasure of viewing both you and your Chairman of the Board,
Mr. Frank Pace, being interviewed by Edward Newman on the TODAY Show.
The discussion was of great interest to me because of my recent appointment
to the Essex County Cultural & Heritage Commission.
We nave been chosen by the Board of Freeholders of Essex County as proposed
by the State legislation under Assembly Bill II20, copy of which I enclose. We
ere extending a public service and it is our main job to make the public aware
of, get them to become involved in, and help them to enjoy all the cultural and
heritage activities existing in our County.
Your statement regarding local govenment involvement, led me to write yoli and
(ask how as a govenment agency we can be useful to a service such as yours.
How would an agency such as yours coordinate with a local government group
'and what was your reason for making your statement.
We would be most grateful for any and all considerations extended to us. A
; cultural and heritagejsommission is to be set up in every county in New Jersey
and we have just been in existence since November, J 968. We feel through the
assistance of all public medias, such as radio, TV, newspapers, magazines,
public involvement in municipalities there is much we can accomplish.
Thank you for allowing me this time in your busy schedule, but we are sincerely
interested in doing a thorough job and only by pursuing all avenues, can this be
done. Looking forward to hearing from.
